quote: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quote: All that is gold does not glitter, not all those who wander are lost.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quote: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
author: Robert Frost

quote: The world breaks everyone, and afterward, some are strong at the broken places.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: The truth is rarely pure and never simple.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: To the well-organized mind, death is but the next great adventure.
book: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: It is our choices that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.
book: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: We are all fools in love.
author: Jane Austen

quote: A room without books is like a body without a soul.
author: Plato

quote: The only way to deal with an unfree world is to become so absolutely free that your very existence is an act of rebellion.
author: Albert Camus

quote: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Nelson Mandela

quote: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
book: Mahatma Gandhi: His Life and Ideas
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: In the end, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quote: All that we see or seem is but a dream within a dream.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
author: Peter Drucker

quote: Do not go gentle into that good night. Rage, rage against the dying of the light.
book: Do Not Go Gentle into That Good Night
author: Dylan Thomas

quote: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow is our doubts of today.
book: The Works of Franklin D. Roosevelt
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: To love and be loved is to feel the sun from both sides.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: I am no bird; and no net ensnares me: I am a free human being with an independent will.
author: Charlotte Brontë

quote: The best of us must sometimes eat our words.
author: William Makepeace Thackeray

quote: I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library.
author: Jorge Luis Borges

quote: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

quote: You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
author: George Eliot

quote: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.
author: John Lennon

quote: Everything you can imagine is real.
author: Salvador Dalí

quote: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: We accept the love we think we deserve.
book: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
author: Stephen Chbosky

quote: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
author: Buddha

quote: There is no friend as loyal as a book.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.
book: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: I would rather be a little nobody, then to be an evil somebody.
author: Frances Hodgson Burnett

quote: The best way out is always through.
author: Robert Frost

quote: It is not length of life, but depth of life.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: The only impossible journey is the one you never begin.
book: The Old Man and the Sea
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The greatest wealth is to live content with little.
author: Plato

author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quote: The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read.

quote: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

quote: It is not the years in your life that count. It is the life in your years.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: The unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates
